intro: Bahia gilliesii, commonly known as desert bluebunch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and blue to purple flower clusters. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as desert scrub and rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and the flowers are arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Bahia gilliesii is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
